role.name: Scheduling Coordinator
role.description:
Job ID: 4122
Position Summary
Assist the Project Controls Manager in the development of business unit scheduling and project controls standard operating procedure. Work with Project Teams to implement company standard project scheduling processes and procedures. This may include training project team members on understanding principles of project scheduling and controls as well as use of tools. Constant evaluation of levels of proficiencies in areas of project controls will also be required. Active hands on assistance with weekly reviews, bid schedules and resource demand forecasting.

Primary/Essential Responsibilities and Duties

  • Lead short term and long term planning for construction activities using Primavera P6.
  • Update construction and engineering updates of the master schedule using P6.
  • Review projects to schedule status. May require assisting project with process.
  • Assist with project controls and reporting aspects of subcontract management process.
  • Assist in the implementation of project progress monitoring measurement system.
  • Assist in initial project set up, short term planning and overall project scheduling duties.
  • Assist with troubleshooting of projects.
  • Oversee progress entry process
  • Perform interim schedule evaluations, delay analysis for contractual notifications

Required Skills and Qualifications

  • 3-5 years in construction industry, preferably in rail transportation industry.
  • Experience on large multi scope construction projects is considered an asset
  • Thorough knowledge of project management practices which includes understanding contracts, planning & scheduling, cost control, earned value and change management.
  • Working knowledge of accounting systems, experience with JDE a plus.
  • Ability to meet deadlines
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient with creating and working with Microsoft excel documents
  • Excellent Scheduling skills. With Primavera P6
  • Highly self-motivated
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Proven analytical and creative problem-solving abilities
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
  • Strong customer service orientation
  • Strong organization and interpersonal skills

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions

  • Overtime may be required to meet project deadlines
  • Works in an office and job site environments
  • Frequently sits for long periods of time
  • Frequently speaks, reads, writes and uses a computer keyboard
  • May require occasional standing, walking, lifting, stooping, or bending

#LI-RG1-PNR
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.

role.name: Certified Exterminator Pesticide Operator/Leader (Arboriculture Industry)
role.description:
Company description:

Full services arborist services include arborist consultation and reports, full tree services, plant health care, and IPM, Christmas light installation.

Job description:

We want YOU to join our team of professionals; We are presently hiring for

"Two positions" Licensed Exterminator/Pesticide Operator & Plant Health Care Crew Lead

Licensed Exterminator/Pesticide Operator Qualifications

· To be considered for this position a candidate must possess a valid commercial pesticide applicator/exterminator license.

· A valid driver’s license with a clean driver abstract is required.

· Previous experience working as a PHC/IPM technician using injectable pesticides is considered an asset.

Plant Health Care Crew Leader "Additional Qualifications"

· In addition to possessing a valid commercial pesticide applicator/exterminator license as a crew leader you must be an ISA Certified Arborist.

· Being familiar with the principles of Integrated Pest Management (IPM) is an asset.

· As part of Tree Doctors onboarding and orientation all new hires will be provided training on the safety and technical aspects of injectable pesticides (TreeAzin, ImaJet, AceCaps, etc.) in preparation for the requirement that he or she inspects all equipment, tools, vehicles, and product for any and all deficiency; bringing to their immediate supervisor’s attention concerns and/or issues.

Duties and Responsibilities (will include but not be limited to)

· Must complete all company assigned paperwork on the job site on a daily basis, including such documentation as tailboard meeting paperwork, on-site health, and safety documentation, daily and weekly completion logs.

· Candidates must be ready, willing and able to work outdoors in varying and sometimes adverse weather conditions, be punctual, reliable and able to follow written and verbal instructions.

· Candidates will need to load and offload heavy objects and products repeatedly throughout the day at each job site location.

· Candidates must always safeguard other employees, the public and surrounding areas at each job site from hazards in and around their work areas.

· Work alongside your peer’s day to day to complete assigned tree injections and keep accurate and up to date logs as well as product inventories.

· Candidates must be able to communicate in a clear and precise manner with management, colleagues, and members of the public when needed.

· Candidates must adhere to all company policies and procedures including health and safety, WHMIS procedures and ensure that PPE is in proper working condition and is worn at all times.

· Having even basic knowledge of equipment, vehicles, and tools is an asset (especially when you are at a job-site).

· Understanding of species-specific insects, disease and cultural tending practices for common area trees are an asset; having solid knowledge of tree/shrub identification is an asset.

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Vision care
  • Disability insurance
  • Vacation & paid time off
  • Dental care
  • Life insurance
  • Bonus scheme
  • On-site parking
  • Company events & social hours
  • Education reimbursement

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00 to $30.00 /hour

Experience:

  • Exterminator/PHC: 2 years (Required)

Licence:

  • commercial pesticide applicator/exterminator (Required)

role.name: Registered Practical Nurse (R.P.N.)
role.description:
Job requirements

Languages

English

Education

College/CEGEP

Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.)

CPR Certificate; Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) Certificate

Experience

1 to less than 7 months

Area of Specialization
Geriatrics
Work Setting
Chronic or long-term care facilities/centres; Nursing home/home for the aged
Licensed Practical Nurse Specific Skills
Take vital signs, apply aseptic techniques including sterile dressing, ensure infection control, monitore nutritional intake and conduct specimen collection; Provide nursing services, within defined scope of practice, to patients based on patient assessment and care planning procedures; Monitor patients' progress, evaluate effectiveness of nursing interventions and consult with appropriate members of healthcare team
